pageContext.description: Circular plate with a band rising from a central aperture giving the object the appearance of a hat. The rim is grooved with circular indentations. If it is complete possibly it was a stand for supporting a glass vessel.
pageContext.publications: Catalogue p. 87. Also see Ousley, "Transactions Royal Irish Academy VI, pp. 31-33.
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science and Art, Dublin,PLate XIV, 274, W276
pageContext.remarks: Wilde believed that this was one of four plates which were found by a peasant.
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
